sen.j: 稲葉 正益（いなば まさよし、享保3年（1718年） - 明和8年9月28日 (旧暦)（1771年11月4日））は、山城国淀藩の第5代藩主。
sen.e: Masayoshi INABA (1718 to November 4, 1771) was the fifth lord of the Yodo Domain in Yamashiro Province.
Masayoshi INABA (1718 to November 4, 1771) was the fifth lord of the Yodo Domain in Yamashiro Province.
Masayoshi INABA (1718 to November 4, 1771) was the fifth lord of the Yodo Domain in Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: toをハイフンに訂正しました。

sen.e: He was the ninth head of the main Inaba family, which descended from Masashige KUSUNOKI's lineage.
He was the ninth head of the main Inaba family, which descended from Masashige KUSUNOKI's lineage.
He was the ninth head of the main Inaba family, which descended from Masashige KUSUNOKI's lineage.

sen.j: 第4代藩主・稲葉正親の長男。
sen.e: Masayoshi was the eldest son of Masachika INABA, the fourth lord of the Yodo Domain.
Masayoshi was the eldest son of Masachika INABA, the fourth lord of the Yodo Domain.
Masayoshi was the eldest son of Masachika INABA, the fourth lord of the Yodo Domain.

sen.j: 母は柴田某の娘（稲葉正直の養女）。
sen.e: The mother was Soregashi SHIBATA's daughter (Masanao INABA's adopted daughter).
The mother was Soregashi SHIBATA's daughter (Masanao INABA's adopted daughter).
The mother was Soregashi SHIBATA's daughter (Masanao INABA's adopted daughter).
His first officially recognized wife was Yoshimura DATE's daughter.
His first officially recognized wife was Yoshimura DATE's daughter.
His first officially recognized wife was Yoshimura DATE's daughter.
His second wife was Takahiro NIWA's daughter.
His second wife was Takahiro NIWA's daughter.
His second wife was Takahiro NIWA's daughter.

sen.j: 子に稲葉正弘（長男）、稲葉正諶（次男）、稲葉正尹（三男）、仙石久功（四男）、娘（立花種周正室）、娘（稲葉正峯正室）。
sen.e: He had six children: Masahiro INABA (eldest son), Masanobu INABA (second son), Masatada INABA (third son), Hisakatsu SENGOKU (fourth son), a daughter (Tanechika TACHIBANA's officially recognized wife) and another daughter (Masataka INABA's officially recognized wife).
sen.cmt: 稲葉正尹、稲葉正峯および仙石久功の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: He had six children: Masahiro INABA (eldest son), Masanobu INABA (second son), Masatada INABA (third son), Hisakatsu SENGOKU (fourth son), a daughter (Tanechika TACHIBANA's officially recognized wife) and another daughter (Masataka INABA's officially recognized wife).

He had six children: Masahiro INABA (eldest son), Masanobu INABA (second son), Masatada INABA (third son), Hisakatsu SENGOKU (fourth son), a daughter (Tanechika TACHIBANA's officially recognized wife) and another daughter (Masataka INABA's officially recognized wife).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、従四位下、内匠頭、丹後国守。
sen.e: He was awarded the ranks of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Grade, Lower Rank) and Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Grade, Lower Rank) and was given official titles as takumi-no-kami (the head of the Bureau of Skilled Artisans) and the governor of Tango Province.

He was awarded the ranks of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Grade, Lower Rank) and Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Grade, Lower Rank) and was given official titles as takumi-no-kami (the head of the Bureau of Skilled Artisans) and the governor of Tango Province.

He was awarded the ranks of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Grade, Lower Rank) and Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Grade, Lower Rank) and was given official titles as takumi no kami (the head of the Bureau of Skilled Artisans) and Tango no kuni no kami (governor of Tango Province).
sen.cmt: takumi-no-kami、ハイフン削除スペース補足しました。丹後国守→Tango no kuni no kami、説明を括弧に入れました。

sen.j: 享保19年（1734年）、父の死去により後を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1734, Masayoshi succeeded his father as the lord of his domain after the latter's death.
In 1734, Masayoshi succeeded his father as the lord of his domain after the latter's death.
In 1734, Masayoshi succeeded his father as the lord of his domain after the latter's death.

sen.j: 奏者番と寺社奉行を兼任した。
sen.e: He was appointed by the shogunate as sojaban (official in charge of ceremonies) and jishabugyo (official in charge of temples and shrines).
He was appointed by the shogunate as sojaban (official in charge of ceremonies) and jishabugyo (official in charge of temples and shrines).
He was appointed by the shogunate as sojaban (official in charge of ceremonies) and jishabugyo (official in charge of temples and shrines).

sen.j: 藩においては淀城が焼失するという事件が起こったこともある。
sen.e: During his rule, the castle in his domain (Yodo Castle) was burned down in a fire.
During his rule, the castle in his domain (Yodo Castle) was burned down in a fire.
During his rule, the castle in his domain (Yodo Castle) was burned down in a fire.

sen.j: 明和8年（1771年）9月28日、54歳で死去し、後を長男の正弘が継いだ。
sen.e: On September 28 (traditional Japanese calendar month), 1771, he died at the age of 54 and was succeeded by Masahiro, his eldest son.
On September 28 (traditional Japanese calendar month), 1771, he died at the age of 54 and was succeeded by Masahiro, his eldest son.
November 4, 1771, he died at the age of 54 and was succeeded by Masahiro, his eldest son.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Onryoin.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Onryoin.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Onryoin.
His grave is in Myoshin-ji Temple in Kyoto.
His grave is in Myoshin-ji Temple in Kyoto.
His grave is in Myoshin-ji Temple in Kyoto.
